page.title: 03OLDER HOUSING
page.content: Most housing in the past was to be found in the original villages of {Houston and Crosslee. Other houses included large country manors.e.g.Craigends House(now demolished), and scattered farmhouses. The original village of Houston consisted of{North and South Streets which run at right angles to the main Johnstone to Langbank road. Houses are{18th. and 19th. century}in age, mainly terraced single storey cottage style, fronting onto narrow streets and made of local stone with slate roofs, chimney heads and sash windows. Many have an added storey with dormers. Gap sites appeared with dereliction, but have been filled by cottages of traditional design made of modern materials. Other gap sites have been used as car parks.
